meanings.definition: A device used for determining direction, typically consisting of a magnetized needle that points to the magnetic north.
meanings.sent1: The hiker used a compass to find the way back to the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The captain relied on the compass to navigate the ship through the storm.
meanings.sent3: The lost explorer thought his compass was playing a trick on him.
meanings.sent4: Her moral compass always guided her towards making the right decisions.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle quivered as it settled on the correct direction.

meanings.definition: An instrument for drawing circles and arcs.
meanings.sent1: The student used a compass to draw a perfect circle for the art project.
meanings.sent2: The architect's compass helped in creating precise blueprints for the building.
meanings.sent3: The compass slipped from the artist's hand, creating a messy design on the paper.
meanings.sent4: Her compass traced a beautiful arc on the canvas, capturing the essence of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The compass point left a clear mark on the paper as it drew a circle.

meanings.definition: To go around (something) in a circular course.
meanings.sent1: The dog likes to compass around the tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The dancer will compass gracefully around the stage during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to compass around the playground for fun.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to compass around the mountain, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The car will compass around the block before finding a parking spot.
